page.title: 05TREVITHICK DAY CAMBORNE
page.content: {R.Trevithick born 1777 died 1833. The purpose of Trevithick Day is to celebrate both the work of Richard Trevithick and Camborne's heritage in the Mining Industry. The festival is a one day event of free entertainment. It has already become a focal point for the community through which local groups and charities are able to raise funds. R.Trevithick was a railway pioneer,born Pool,and built the steam engine{"Catch me Who can".}There is a Trevithick Society in the Camborne area for local people interested in Industial Archaeology.The society studes old engine houses and mining works.The highlight of Trevithick Day is a group of dances performed by local schools and people in the area.The dance steps were decided by a competition,including the costume colours of black,yellow and white.
